headers.subject: [tosdr:2549] Instagram keeps your content after termination for archival purposes

html:
• Following termination or deactivation of your account, Instagram, its Affiliates, or its Service Providers may retain information (including your profile information) and User Content for a commercially reasonable time for backup, archival, and/or audit purposes.
http://instagram.com/about/legal/privacy/

I personally find "commercially reasonable" to be a bit vague. I'm aware that "reasonable" here is used in the very legal sense of the word, so could someone maybe shed a bit of light on that? I've written a proposed point below.


Title: Instagram keeps your content after termination for archival purposes

Topic: personal-data

Summary: When you delete or deactivate your account, Instangram may keep your information for backup, archival, and/or audit purposes. They may keep this information for a commercially reasonable time.

Score: 50 (mediocre)

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr

subject: Instagram keeps your content after termination for archival purposes
text:
>
>
>    - Following termination or deactivation of your account, Instagram, 
>    its Affiliates, or its Service Providers may retain information (including 
>    your profile information) and User Content for a commercially reasonable 
>    time for backup, archival, and/or audit purposes.
>
> http://instagram.com/about/legal/privacy/

I personally find "commercially reasonable" to be a bit vague. I'm aware 
that "reasonable" here is used in the very legal sense of the word, so 
could someone maybe shed a bit of light on that? I've written a proposed 
point below.


Title: Instagram keeps your content after termination for archival purposes

Topic: personal-data

Summary: When you delete or deactivate your account, Instangram may keep 
your information for backup, archival, and/or audit purposes. They may keep 
this information for a commercially reasonable time.
